text: Python readability hints for a Java programmer
I'm a java programmer, but now entering the "realm of python" for some stuff for which Python works better.
I'm quite sure a good portion of my code would look weird for a Python programmer (e.g.
I know each language has its own conventions and set of "habits".
So, from a readability standpoint what are conventions and practices which is "the way to go" in Java, but are not really the "pythonic way" to do stuff?
